context_evidences: - Some of the titles mentioned in the list circulating online are included in Florida’s Benchmarks for Excellent Student Thinking (B.E.S.T.) Standards including ‘1984’, ‘Of Mice and Men’ and ‘Lord of the Flies’. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/factcheck-florida-books/fact-check-florida-has-not-banned-of-mice-and-men-and-other-classics-for-being-woke-idUSL1N3000ZJ published on 2022-08-24 12:59:17

- “As far as I see it, this is just a completely fictitious list made by people potentially living in an alternate reality,” said Redfern. Reference: https://thedispatch.com/article/fact-checking-a-viral-claim-about/ published on 2022-09-01 15:54:43

- PEN America, a non-profit organization that advocates for freedom of expression, confirmed the titles in the list circulating online does not show titles that have been banned or removed across the state. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/factcheck-florida-books/fact-check-florida-has-not-banned-of-mice-and-men-and-other-classics-for-being-woke-idUSL1N3000ZJ published on 2022-08-24 12:59:17

- Florida statute 1006.28 establishes: “Each district school board is responsible for the content of all instructional materials and any other materials used in a classroom, made available in a school library, or included on a reading list, whether adopted and purchased from the state-adopted instructional materials list.” Reference: https://thedispatch.com/article/fact-checking-a-viral-claim-about/ published on 2022-09-01 15:54:43
correction_response:
This tweet is misinformed. The list of banned books in Florida is fake. Florida law allows parents to review and contest school reading materials, but the decision to ban books falls to the school districts, not the state. Many of the books listed, including "To Kill a Mockingbird", "1984", "Call of the Wild", "Of Mice and Men", and "Lord of the Flies", are actually recommended reading in Florida. The list appears to be a fabrication, as confirmed by the press secretary for Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis and PEN America, a non-profit organization advocating for freedom of expression.

https://www.reuters.com/article/factcheck-florida-books/fact-check-florida-has-not-banned-of-mice-and-men-and-other-classics-for-being-woke-idUSL1N3000ZJ
note_1_text: This list of Florida banned books is a debunked fake.     https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/factcheck/2022/08/25/fact-check-fake-list-banned-florida-books-circulates-widely-online/7876468001/
note_2_text: While Florida does not appear to have an official banned books list, recent training for school librarians developed by the state education department does appear to cast a wide net https://www.edweek.org/leadership/new-training-tells-florida-school-librarians-which-books-are-off-limits/2023/01
queries:
1. List of banned books in Florida schools
2. Reasons for banning "A Wrinkle in Time" in Florida
3. Controversy over "The Handmaid's Tale" ban in Florida
4. "Harry Potter series" banned in Florida schools
5. Florida's policy on banning books in schools
refute_evidences: - This list is fake. Florida passed a law in March that allows parents to review which books are required reading and books found in the library, and under the new law the parents can also contest materials. The law also requires the state to maintain a list of materials that school districts remove as a result of parental complaints. But that decision to ban books or other teaching materials falls to the school districts, not the state itself. Reference: https://thedispatch.com/article/fact-checking-a-viral-claim-about/ published on 2022-09-01 15:54:43

- The press secretary for Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis noted that To Kill a Mockingbird —one of the books on the fake list—is not only not banned, but is recommended reading. In an email to The Dispatch Fact Check , Jeremy Redfern, deputy press secretary for DeSantis, pointed out that 1984 , Call of the Wild , Of Mice and Men , and Lord of the Flies are also all on Florida’s list of recommended books for school curriculum. Reference: https://thedispatch.com/article/fact-checking-a-viral-claim-about/ published on 2022-09-01 15:54:43

- The list is fabricated, however, and the mentioned titles have not been banned across the state. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/factcheck-florida-books/fact-check-florida-has-not-banned-of-mice-and-men-and-other-classics-for-being-woke-idUSL1N3000ZJ published on 2022-08-24 12:59:17

- There is no state-wide ban on book titles, Byran Griffin, spokesperson for the state’s Governor Ron DeSantis, told Reuters by email. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/factcheck-florida-books/fact-check-florida-has-not-banned-of-mice-and-men-and-other-classics-for-being-woke-idUSL1N3000ZJ published on 2022-08-24 12:59:17
